data.question: Does the synthesis of SCU-UEu-2 involve a hydrothermal reaction?
What is the main advantage of SCU-UEu-2 over other Eu-MOFs according to the study?
data.answer: SCU-UEu-2 has a record-breaking photoluminescence quantum yield (PLQY) among all reported Eu-MOFs.

data.question: What is the absorption range of uranyl ion mentioned in the text?
What computational method was used for the energy transfer efficiency calculations?
data.answer: Time-dependent density functional theory (TDDFT) and ab initio wave-function theory (WFT) calculations

data.question: Is SCU-UEu-2 stable under high humidity conditions?
data.answer: Yes, SCU-UEu-2 retains more than 80% of its initial XEL output under high humidity.

data.question: What is the main challenge in the direct excitation of Ln3+ ions as mentioned in the text?
data.answer: The direct excitation of Ln3+ is very inefficient unless high-power laser excitation is utilized due to their electric-dipole forbidden 4f–4f transitions.

data.question: What is the significance of the 'antenna effect' in the context of lanthanide organic frameworks?
data.answer: The 'antenna effect' utilizes organic linkers with strong absorption chromophores to sensitize Ln3+ emission, leading to a high photoluminescence quantum yield.
